com.yantra.api.inv

Interface transferInventoryOwnership

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.INVApi, YIFApi

    public interface transferInventoryOwnership

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document transferInventoryOwnership(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The transferInventoryOwnership API can be used to manually transfer the ownership of inventory from one organization to another organization.

    • Method Detail

      • transferInventoryOwnership

        org.w3c.dom.Document transferInventoryOwnership(YFSEnvironment env,
                                                org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                         throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                                java.rmi.RemoteException

        The transferInventoryOwnership API can be used to manually transfer the ownership of inventory from one organization to another organization. Inventory owned by FromOrgnaizationCode will be deducted while the inventory owned by ToOrganizationCode will be increased. The API adjustInventory is called twice, first, to decrease the inventory supply at the FromOrganizationCode and second, to increase the inventory supply at the ToOrganization This also means that all those events like INVENTORY_CHANGE and SUPPLY_CHANGE which are raised by adjustInventory once will get raised twice while manually transferring the inventory ownership using this API. Manual transfer of inventory can happen both ways.i.e from vendor to enterprise or from enterprise to vendor.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:None

        Events Raised:
        ON_INV_OWNERSHIP_TRNSFR - This event is raised under transaction INVENTORY_CHANGE.

        Key Data: INV_INVENTORY_CHANGE.ON_INV_OWNERSHIP_TRNSFR_dbd.txt

        Data Published: INV_INVENTORY_CHANGE.ON_INV_OWNERSHIP_TRNSFR.xml

        INVENTORY_CHANGE - This event is raised two times,first while decreasing supply at source inventory organization and then while increasing supply at target inventory organization.

        Key Data: INVENTORY_CHANGE.INVENTORY_CHANGE_dbd.txt
        Data Published: INV_INVENTORY_CHANGE.INVENTORY_CHANGE.xml

        SUPPLY_CHANGE This event is raised two times,first while decreasing supply at source inventory organization and then while increasing supply at target inventory organization.

        Key Data: INVENTORY_CHANGE.SUPPLY_CHANGE_dbd.txt
        Data Published: INV_INVENTORY_CHANGE.SUPPLY_CHANGE.xml

        Template Support: No


        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility:
        N/A.

        Audits:
        When inventory ownership transfer occurs, the audit information will be logged into the YFS_INV_OWN_TRANSFER_RCD table. Furthermore, the audit information will be published in the "ON_INV_OWNERSHIP_TRNSFR" event.
        Note that the event publishes the data even before the transaction gets commited. Integrations around these events should be mindful of this fact.

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions:
        The quantity information in the YFS_INVENTORY_SUPPLY table is updated for items that are specified in the input XML file for both from and to organizations

        Output Template Support: No

        Database Extensibility Support: N/A

        Additional Information:
        API throws error if availability is maintained externally for primary enterprise code of inventory organization or ShipNode.

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. Contains the inventory data. For more information on the inventory data, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        Null.
        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
